questions.question: What does 'Kurze Rochade' mean when announced by a visually impaired player?
questions.source: FIDE Laws of Chess - Appendix D

metadata.hard_reason: TRICKY: German term 'Kurze Rochade' for blind players - retrieval must link German chess terminology to Appendix D rules
metadata.corpus_truth: Appendix D.2 (p55): 'Kurze Rochade' = German for 'short castling' (kingside O-O). Used when blind player announces moves verbally.

questions.question: According to FIDE Laws, at what exact moment is an illegal move considered 'completed'?

metadata.hard_reason: TRICKY: Technical definition - 'completed' has precise legal meaning (not intuitive). Tests semantic understanding of technical terms.
metadata.corpus_truth: Article 7.5.1 (p36): 'An illegal move is completed once the player has pressed his/her clock.' Clock press = completion trigger.

questions.question: Under what circumstances is pressing the chess clock before making a move permitted?

metadata.hard_reason: TRICKY: Negation trap - question asks 'permitted' but answer is NEVER (forbidden). Tests retrieval with inverted logic.
metadata.corpus_truth: Article 6.2.4 (p30): 'It is forbidden to press the clock before moving.' Answer: NEVER permitted - explicitly prohibited.
